DRM101Y1-Y-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM101Y1-Y-20229.courseTitle: Introduction to Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies
DRM101Y1-Y-20229.courseDescription: The course introduces students to key concepts and issues in the three related disciplines at the core of our program: drama, theatre, and performance studies. We consider broader questions of performance and performativity in daily life. Engaging critically with theoretical and dramatic texts and live performances, students learn how to think about performance in its cultural, social, historical, aesthetic and political dimensions, and how to acknowledge and navigate their own responsibilities as culture workers situated in specific historical and contemporary contexts. This course combines weekly two-hour lectures with one-hour tutorials.
DRM101Y1-Y-20229.exclusion: DRM100Y1, DRE121H5, DRE122H5, VPDA10H3, VPDA11H3, VPDA10H3, VPDA15H3, VPDB10H3, VPDB11H3
DRM101Y1-Y-20229.breadthCategories: Creative and Cultural Representations (1), Society and its Institutions (3)

enrollmentControls.adminOrgName: Centre for Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies

enrollmentControls.primaryOrgName: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design
enrollmentControls.adminOrgName: Centre for Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies

DRM200Y1-Y-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM200Y1-Y-20229.courseDescription: Emphasis is initially placed on ensemble, non-verbal, and improvisational work. Students proceed to the application of their acquired skills to scripted material. Students may apply in their first or second year of University. The Application Deadline is March 10th for the first round of auditions; August 10th for the second round. Priority is given to Drama Specialists and Majors. Please consult the CDTPS undergraduate web page for information on how to apply.
DRM200Y1-Y-20229.prerequisite: An audition and interview in April or in August. Newly admitted students can apply for an audition before beginning their first year of studies.
DRM200Y1-Y-20229.exclusion: DRS221H5 AND DRS222H5; VPDB01H3 AND VPDB02H3
DRM200Y1-Y-20229.webTimetableInstructions: There are two rounds of auditions and interviews: March 10th and August 10th. See DRM200Y Audition Guidelines for more information.
DRM200Y1-Y-20229.deliveryInstructions: Friday classes are reserved for Voice & Movement instruction.

DRM202H1-F-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM202H1-F-20229.courseDescription: A practical introduction to directing theatre and to the different styles, concerns, and goals that can guide directors in their relations to actors, audiences, and politics. Through lectures, discussions, and practical exercises, students learn how directors prepare for their work in terms of generating ideas, breaking down a text, animating space, and communicating with actors and audiences. Priority will be given to students in the Drama Specialist and Major.

DRM220Y1-Y-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM220Y1-Y-20229.courseDescription: This course will introduce students to major developments in world theatre history through the exploration of a wide range of plays, performances, and practices. In the Fall term our trajectory will go roughly from antiquity to the 16th Century; in the Winter term, from the 16th Century to the present. We will examine material from Africa, America, Asia, Europe, and Oceania, with close attention to the social, religious, historical, aesthetic, and political parameters in which theatre and performance take place. Nurturing ethnically sensitive approaches to world theatre history, this course considers the many ways theatre and performance interact with the globalized world. Students will have an opportunity to participate in collaborative projects and focus on writing for research in the performing arts.
DRM220Y1-Y-20229.breadthCategories: Creative and Cultural Representations (1), Thought, Belief and Behaviour (2)

DRM228H1-S-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM228H1-S-20229.courseDescription: A hands-on study of the craft of dramatic writing. The class examines the basic elements of playwriting such as plot, structure, theme, character, dialogue, setting, with an emphasis on story-making. Attention is given to the development of students own work through written assignments and in-class exercises. Priority will be given to students in the Drama Specialist and Major.

DRM254H1-F-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM254H1-F-20229.courseDescription: A practical and theoretical introduction to the fundamentals of theatrical performance design. This course touches on theatre architecture, conceptual approaches to theatrical design and spatial considerations of live performance. Students will work on case studies and practical projects geared toward understanding theatre terminology, design, and production processes. Students will also explore concrete aspects of technical theatre production, particularly as they pertain to theatrical design elements. Priority will be given to students in the Drama Specialist and Major.

enrollmentControls.primaryOrgName: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design
John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

DRM300Y1-Y-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM300Y1-Y-20229.courseDescription: Building upon the work of DRM200Y1, students concentrate on scene study, styles of acting, and the development of ensemble work with an intensive focus on voice and movement practices. Restricted to students in the Drama Specialist and Major or by permission from the Centre. Please consult the CDTPS Application Guidelines for information on how to apply. Applications are due on March 10th.
DRM300Y1-Y-20229.prerequisite: Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM101Y1 and DRM200Y1; an application
DRM300Y1-Y-20229.corequisite: DRM220Y1 or any course from Group A if DRM220Y1 is complete
DRM300Y1-Y-20229.webTimetableInstructions: The application deadline is March 10th. Please consult the CDTPS Application Guidelines for details on how to apply.
DRM300Y1-Y-20229.deliveryInstructions: Thursday classes are reserved for Voice & Movement instruction.

DRM302H1-S-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM302H1-S-20229.courseDescription: A continuation of DRM202H1, concentrating on deepening the exploration of what it means to think and work like a director. Through practical exercises and scene study, students learn how to conceptualize a production and how to communicate their vision, as well as deepen their understanding of what is involved in directing actors and collaborating with a production team. Restricted to students in the Drama Specialist and Major or by permission from the Centre (requests can be made once the priority period has opened on Acorn).
DRM302H1-S-20229.prerequisite: Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM101Y1 and DRM202H1
DRM302H1-S-20229.corequisite: DRM220Y1 or any course from Group A.

DRM320H1-S-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM320H1-S-20229.courseTitle: Concepts of Theatre in the Twentieth and Twenty-first Centuries
DRM320H1-S-20229.courseDescription: An exploration of the shifting landscapes of European theatre theory, history and practice in the late 19th century and their repercussions throughout the 20th and 21st centuries. The course focuses on the developments of modern and post-dramatic theatre. It also includes critical analysis of the annual Drama Mainstage production and current Canadian theatre.

DRM328H1-F-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM328H1-F-20229.courseDescription: A continuation of DRM228H1, concentrating on the in-depth knowledge and practice of playwriting with an emphasis on style and technique of writing for the stage. Students develop their own work through written assignments, in-class exercises, and a final public presentation. Restricted to students in the Drama Specialist and Major or by permission from the Centre. An application and writing samples (due April 10th) are required in order to be considered for enrollment in this course. Please consult the CDTPS undergraduate web page for information on how to apply.
DRM328H1-F-20229.prerequisite: Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM101Y1; DRM228H1; and a portfolio of writing samples due on April 10th.
DRM328H1-F-20229.corequisite: DRM220Y1 or any course from Group A
DRM328H1-F-20229.webTimetableInstructions: An application and writing samples are required in order to be considered for enrollment in this course. The application deadlines are March 10th and August 10th.  Please consult the CDTPS Application Guidelines for further details.

DRM331H1-F-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM331H1-F-20229.courseDescription: An introduction to the theory and practice of dramaturgy in its many theatrical manifestations: from preparatory research to script analysis, from new play development to audience dramaturgy.

DRM342H1-F-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM342H1-F-20229.courseDescription: This class, while exploring significant artistic and sociopolitical developments of the historical avant-garde, will primarily concentrate on the experimental theatre and performance of the past 25 yearsa contemporary avant-garde that, as Paige McGinley describes, hinge[s] on a networked spatiality, rather than on linear teleology and reflects a growing collective investment on part of audiences and artists alike in the work of a work of art.

enrollmentControls.adminOrgName: Centre for Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies

enrollmentControls.primaryOrgName: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design
enrollmentControls.adminOrgName: Centre for Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies

DRM354H1-S-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM354H1-S-20229.courseDescription: An intermediate-level investigation of various aspects of theatrical performance design, with a focus on scenic and costume design, though also considering the impact of projections and lighting. Using skills developed through practical study in the Design Studio, the students form the core of the design team for Drama productions. Restricted to students in the Drama Specialist and Major or by permission from the Centre (requests can be made once the priority period has opened on Acorn).
DRM354H1-S-20229.prerequisite: Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM101Y1 and DRM254H1.
DRM354H1-S-20229.corequisite: DRM220Y1 or any course from Group A

enrollmentControls.primaryOrgName: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

DRM355H1-S-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM355H1-S-20229.courseDescription: An intermediate-level hands-on investigation of various aspects of theatrical production, including stage management, lighting and sound design, and video design. Using the skills developed in this course, students will form the core of the production team for a number of CDTPS productions. Restricted to students in the Drama Specialist and Major or by permission from the Centre (requests can be made once the priority period has opened on Acorn).
DRM355H1-S-20229.prerequisite: Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM101Y1 and DRM254H1
DRM355H1-S-20229.corequisite: DRM220Y1 or any course from Group A

enrollmentControls.primaryOrgName: John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design
John H. Daniels Faculty of Architecture, Landscape, & Design

DRM368H1-F-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM368H1-F-20229.courseDescription: An in-depth, hands-on study of devising theatre in a group context. This course offers an intensive exploration of the history and practice of devised theatre within the late 20th and early 21st centuries that will culminate in a number of in-class and public presentations.
DRM368H1-F-20229.prerequisite: Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM101Y1 and DRM200Y1/ DRM202H1/ DRM224H1/ DRM228H1/ DRM254H1

DRM375H1-F-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM375H1-F-20229.courseDescription: A focused, in-depth practice-based examination of specific performance disciplines, styles, and genres, considered within their historical and critical context. Content will vary depending on instructor. Please check Studio Topics under Group B on the CDTPS undergraduate web page for more details. Priority will be given to students in the Drama Specialist and Major.
DRM375H1-F-20229.prerequisite: Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM101Y1, DRM200Y1/ DRM202H1/ DRM224H1/ DRM228H1/ DRM254H1

DRM378H1-S-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM378H1-S-20229.courseDescription: A focused, in-depth practice-based examination of specific performance disciplines, styles, and genres, considered within their historical and critical context. Content will vary depending on instructor. Please check Studio Topics under Group B on the CDTPS undergraduate web page for more details. Priority will be given to students in the Drama Specialist and Major.
DRM378H1-S-20229.prerequisite: Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM101Y1, DRM200Y1/ DRM202H1/ DRM224H1/ DRM228H1/ DRM254H1

DRM388H1-S-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM388H1-S-20229.courseTitle: Special Topics in Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies
DRM388H1-S-20229.courseDescription: A focused, in-depth examination of specific issues in drama, theatre and performance studies. Special Topics vary for Breadth distribution depending on the course content. Please check Special Topics under Group A on the CDTPS undergraduate web page for more details.

enrollmentControls.adminOrgName: Centre for Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies

DRM391H1-F-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM391H1-F-20229.courseTitle: Independent Studies in Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies
DRM391H1-F-20229.courseDescription: An independent research project at the 300-level, proposed by the student in conversation with a full-time faculty member who agrees to act as their supervisor for the course. Not eligible for CR/NCR option. Restricted to students in the Drama Specialist and Major. An application and a proposal are required in order to enroll in this course. Please consult the CDTPS Independent Study Policy for further details.
DRM391H1-F-20229.prerequisite: 10.0 credits, Specialist or Major in Drama with a minimum of 70% in DRM220Y1, Independent Study Application Form and description of project/syllabus signed by the student and the faculty supervisor, approval of the Centre for Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies (CDTPS). Application deadlines: August 10th for September start date; November 10th for January start date.
DRM391H1-F-20229.webTimetableInstructions:
Restricted to students in the Drama Specialist and Major. 

An application and a proposal are required in order to enroll in this course. Application deadline is August 10th. Please consult the CDTPS Independent Study Policy for further details.

DRM400H1-F-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM400H1-F-20229.courseDescription: Advanced Performance builds on the training sequence of DRM200Y1 and DRM300Y1 by developing students acting and performance skills in monologues and extensive collaborative scene work. The work focuses on the particulars of character development and the emotional and technical aspects of the actors craft. Restricted to students in the Drama Specialist and Major. Please consult the CDTPS Application Guidelines for information on how to apply. Applications are due on March 10th.
DRM400H1-F-20229.prerequisite: Specialist or Major in Drama; Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM220Y1 and DRM300Y1; an application
DRM400H1-F-20229.corequisite: DRM403Y1 or permission of the Centre
DRM400H1-F-20229.webTimetableInstructions: The application deadline is March 10th. Please consult the CDTPS Application Guidelines for details on how to apply.

DRM402H1-F-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM402H1-F-20229.courseDescription: A hands-on exploration of advanced directing for the theatre. The class is centered on student-directed projects, which are publicly presented at the end of term. An application, a proposal, and an interview in April are required to be considered for enrollment in this course. Please consult the CDTPS Application Guidelines for specific procedures and deadlines.
DRM402H1-F-20229.prerequisite: Specialist or Major in Drama; Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM220Y1, DRM302H1, DRM331H1; a written proposal and an interview in April.
DRM402H1-F-20229.webTimetableInstructions: The application deadline is March 10th. Please consult the CDTPS Application Guidelines for details on how to apply.

DRM403Y1-Y-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM403Y1-Y-20229.courseDescription: This course, taught each year by a different visiting professional theatre director, offers upper-level students the opportunity to explore acting in a full-length production. Plays are selected to challenge students in a variety of different ways, exposing them to a full spectrum of theatre and performance genres and possibilities. Restricted to students in the Drama Specialist and Major. Please consult the CDTPS Application Guidelines for information on how to apply. Applications are due on March 10th.
DRM403Y1-Y-20229.prerequisite: Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM220Y1, DRM300Y1, 0.5 credit from DRM368H1/ DRM375H1/ DRM376H1/ DRM377H1/ DRM378H1; an application
DRM403Y1-Y-20229.webTimetableInstructions: The application deadline is March 10th. Please consult the CDTPS Application Guidelines for details on how to apply.

DRM413H1-S-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM413H1-S-20229.courseDescription: This course is a skill-developing companion to DRM400H1 Advanced Performance, and a co-requisite to DRM403Y1 Mainstage Performance. It exposes students to a wide range of voice and movement techniques and explores a heightened use of physicality, voice and speech. Restricted to students in the Drama Specialist and Major taking DRM403Y1.
DRM413H1-S-20229.prerequisite: Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM220Y1, DRM300Y1, 0.5 credit from DRM368H1/ DRM375H1/ DRM376H1/ DRM377H1/ DRM378H1
DRM413H1-S-20229.webTimetableInstructions: This course is a co-requisite to DRM403Y.

DRM420H1-F-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM420H1-F-20229.courseTitle: Arts and Politics: Bertolt Brecht, Giorgio Strehler, Robert Wilson and Robert Lepage
DRM420H1-F-20229.courseDescription: Bertolt Brecht played a specific role in the paradigm shift of the art which began at the end of the 19th century. He advanced this change by trying to connect art to its social and political functions and structure with the positive acceptance of the industrial revolution and by trying to transform it with the help of the new technological media. Restricted to students in the Drama Specialist or Major.

DRM424H1-S-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM424H1-S-20229.courseDescription: This course introduces students to independent research-creation in the field of contemporary digital performance. Readings and invited guests will expose students to innovative practices in theatres and online platforms, and outline current political and academic debates around liveness, copyright, and social media. Students will pursue research on a contemporary artist who is integrating the performing arts with computational media, and create a performance piece responding to issues raised by their research.

DRM428H1-S-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM428H1-S-20229.courseDescription: A continuation of DRM328H1, concentrating upon the in-depth knowledge and practice of playwriting with an emphasis on advanced style and technique of writing for the stage. Students develop their own longer work through in-class exercises, one major written assignment, and a final public presentation. Restricted to students in the Drama Specialist and Major or by permission from the Centre. An application and writing samples (due November 10th) are required in order to be considered for enrollment in this course. Please consult the CDTPS Application Guidelines for information on how to apply.
DRM428H1-S-20229.prerequisite: Minimum 70% in required courses: DRM220Y1, DRM328H1 and a portfolio of writing samples due November 10th.
DRM428H1-S-20229.webTimetableInstructions: An application and writing samples are required in order to be considered for enrollment in this course. The application deadline is November 10th.  Please consult the CDTPS Application Guidelines for further details.

DRM431H1-S-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM431H1-S-20229.courseDescription: A continuation of DRM331H1 Dramaturgy, deepening the critical exploration of more specific and/or specialized aspects of dramaturgy, such as digital dramaturgy, new media dramaturgy, intercultural and transcultural dramaturgy.

DRM462H1-F-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM462H1-F-20229.courseTitle: Black Playwrights: Resistance, Resilience and Transformation
DRM462H1-F-20229.courseDescription: An exploration of dramatic literature by writers from the African Diaspora (Canada, USA, UK and the Caribbean) from 1959 to the present. The course will identify playwrights central to the development of Black theatre, their plays, and performance practices. Emphasis will be placed on dramaturgical analysis, sociohistorical context, the authors influences, and relevant critical writing, in order to evaluate these works as sites of social resistance, cultural resilience, and aesthetic transformation. Selected authors include: Lorraine Hansberry, Wole Soyinka, August Wilson, Derek Walcott, Debbie Hunter Green, George Elliott Clarke, Tarell Alvin McCraney, Walter Borden, Suzan-Lori Parks, Kwame Kwei-Armah and Ntozake Shange.
DRM462H1-F-20229.exclusion: DRM488H1 (Senior Seminar in Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies: Black Playwrights), offered in Fall 2019

DRM490Y1-Y-20229.orgName: Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies, Centre for (DRM) (JDC) (JIA)
DRM490Y1-Y-20229.courseTitle: Independent Studies in Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies
DRM490Y1-Y-20229.courseDescription: An independent research project at the 400-level, proposed by the student in conversation with a full-time faculty member who agrees to act as their supervisor for the course. Not eligible for CR/NCR option. Restricted to students in the Drama Specialist and Major. An application and a proposal are required in order to enroll in this course. Please consult the CDTPS Independent Study Policy for further details.
DRM490Y1-Y-20229.prerequisite: 14.0 credits, including DRM220Y1 with a minimum of 70%, Specialist or Major in Drama, Independent Study Application Form and description of project/syllabus signed by the student and the faculty supervisor, approval of the Centre for Drama, Theatre and Performance Studies (CDTPS). Application deadline: August 10th for September start date.
DRM490Y1-Y-20229.webTimetableInstructions:
Restricted to students in the Drama Specialist and Major. An application and a proposal are required in order to enroll in this course. Application deadline is August 10th.

Please consult the CDTPS Independent Study Policy for further details.
